column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=China offers Africa financial aid including $ 10 billion in loans
#Text=Sunday , November 8 , 2009
#Text=Members of the FOCAC
#Text=Image : Wangyunfeng .
#Text=China has offered Africa concessional loans worth US$ 10 ( € 6.5 ) billion as part of a host of new measures aimed at improving the economy of African nations .
#Text=The announcement was made at the opening of the Forum on China-Africa Cooperation ( FOCAC ) in Sharm el-Sheikh , Egypt .
#Text=Leaders of nearly 50 African countries are attending the two-day conference .

#Text=China had already stated today at the 3rd Conference of Chinese and African Entrepreneurs , held immediately before the FOCAC , that Chinese firms would be encouraged to invest in Africa , while both sides would work together to improve the tourism , telecommunications and finance industries .
#Text=China also said that governments should work with businesses to ensure co-operation between China and Africa .

#Text=As well as the loans , made over three years , China will write off the debt of Africa 's poorest countries , build 100 African green energy facilities and systematically lower import duties on 95 % of all African products exported to China .
#Text=Another promise is a loan of one billion dollars aimed at small and medium sized businesses in Africa .
#Text=There will also be efforts to promote each other 's culture and increased medical assistance to Africa .
#Text=Medical assistance comes in the form of 500 million yuan ( US$ 73.2 million ) of goods for the 60 hospitals and malaria centers China has already built , as well as 3,000 doctors and nurses .
#Text=Roads will also be improved .
#Text=China also plans to assist with satellite weather monitoring , to help combat desertification and work within the urban environment , all aimed at reducing global warming .
#Text=The new energy facilities will focus on solar , biogas and small-scale hydroelectrical installations .

#Text=Another new measure is a promise to aid African farmers to ensure the continent is fed , increasing the number of demonstrations of agricultural technology in Africa to 20 and sending 50 teams of agricultural technology experts to the continent .
#Text=Training in agricultural technology will be provided to 2,000 people .
#Text="

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=The Chinese people cherish sincere friendship toward the African people , and China 's support to Africa 's development is concrete and real ,  said co-chair Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao as the FOCAC opened up , adding " Whatever change that may take place in the world , our friendship with African people will not change . "

_	_	_	_

#Text=He described this friendship as ' unbreakable ' .

#Text=Jean Ping , leader of the African Union , said the told those at the conference that the money is coming at an opportune time , because African growth was  totally compromised " by the global financial crisis .

column1: #Text=Ping said one of the lessons learned is that the world is paying for " the irresponsible and lax behavior " of large financial companies whose philosophy was to make short-term profits .
#Text=We thank China particularly for backing efforts by our countries to achieve peace and stability in Africa 's zones of conflict — Sudanese President Omar al-Beshir
#Text=Not all Africans are happy with China 's increasing involvement in their continent .
#Text=Trade practices are a concern for some , with a view that China exploits Africa for raw materials before selling back finished goods .
#Text=Among these are Egyptian Trade and Industry Minister Rachid Mohamed Rachid .
#Text=Egypt is the richest nation in the Middle East and is discussing this perceived issue with China .
#Text=Rachid told Bloomberg " What is a worry for me is if competition is unfair .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=Jiabao described the trade as being based on  win-win programmes ... and transparency . "

column1: #Text=Others in Africa are delighted with the situation .
#Text=" We want more investment from China , " Tanzanian President Jakaya Mrisho Kikwete told the forum .
#Text=Egypt 's own President Hosni Mubarak talked of " peace , security and growth , " and of " boosting cooperation between China and Africa . "
#Text=HAVE YOUR SAY China investing in Africa : Good or bad ?
#Text=Add or view comments

#Text=Jiabao also used his speech to respond to criticisms that China worked with nations regardless of their human rights record , such as Sudan , whose President Omar al-Beahir is wanted on a warrant issued by the International Criminal Court for war crimes .
#Text=" Africa is fully capable of solving its own problems , in an African way , " he said , adding that " China has never attached any political strings [ … ] to assistance to Africa . "
#Text=Beshir thanked China in a speech for diplomatic work in Sudan , including working to defuse the Darfur conflict , which the United Nations says has left 300,000 dead .

#Text=" We express our deep appreciation for China 's efforts in backing the comprehensive peace agreement in Sudan and its peace efforts in Darfur , " he said , referring to a peace deal between the northern and southern parts of his country .
#Text=" We thank China particularly for backing efforts by our countries to achieve peace and stability in Africa 's zones of conflict . "
#Text=Jiabao said China was willing to work towards " the settlement of issues of peace and security , " in Africa .
#Text=A further criticism has been that China has brought in Chinese workers and used their own knowledge , instead of training locals .
#Text=Jiabao 's speech indicated an intention to co-operate better in the fields of science and technology , as well as improve training for African students on technical courses .
#Text=" Why do some only criticise China ? " asked Jiabao .
#Text=" Is this a view representing African countries , or rather the view of Western countries ? "
